properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 11 at 3:12AM CST until January 11 at 3:45AM CST by NWS Lake Charles LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Central Calcasieu Parish in southwestern Louisiana...

* Until 345 AM CST.

* At 311 AM CST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing both
tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage were located near
Vinton, moving northeast at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* These dangerous storms will be near...
Edgerly around 315 AM CST.
Carlyss around 325 AM CST.
Lake Charles and Sulphur around 330 AM CST.
Westlake around 335 AM CST.
Moss Bluff around 345 AM CST.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 8 and 34.
Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 3, and near mile marker
12.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile
home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and
protect yourself from flying debris.

This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and
widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the
tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest
floor of a building.

CMAMtext: NWS: TORNADO WARNING in this area til 3:45 AM CST. Take shelter now. Check media.
